thread.title: How UK could get Brexit talks off to rocky start if they trigger Article 50 on THIS DATE
thread.title_full: How UK could get Brexit talks off to rocky start if they trigger Article 50 on THIS DATE

title: How UK could get Brexit talks off to rocky start if they trigger Article 50 on THIS DATE
text:
Our colleagues on the Continent are concerned we might trigger it on that date UK Minister 
They added that: “We often stress this point to our English friends and it seems there’s an understanding.” 
The Treaty of Rome, establishing the European Economic Community (TEEC), is an international agreement that led to the founding of the European Economic Community (EEC). 
It was signed on March 25 1957 by Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands and West Germany and came into force on 1 January 1958. GETTY In 2007 the EU spent millions for celebrations in Berlin for the 50th anniversary 
The first Italian event to promote the anniversary was the meeting "From Rome to Lisbon and beyond – Building a new political community", which was held on 11th April 2016 at the Chamber of Deputies. 
According to an article in the Sunday Telegraph, UK diplomats have considered the calls carefully and are unlikely to trigger Article 50 on March 25. 
Indeed Theresa May is instead said to be considering giving the EU notice that the UK is to leave two weeks earlier on March 9th in order to avoid tensions. GETTY The Treaty of Rome was celebrated by Angela Merkel in Berlin 10 years ago 
An unnamed UK minister added: “Our colleagues on the Continent are concerned we might trigger it on that date. 
"You could see what the temptation is, can’t you? 
“But it might be a bit provocative.” 
Last year Italian Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni who was then foreign minister will hosted a meeting of the Foreign Ministers of the six founders of the European Union at the Villa Madama in Rome, in anticipation of the celebrations for the 60th anniversary. GETTY In 2007 the ECB produced coins to mark the 50th anniversary 
The meeting looked at how the nation states could strengthen the European Union despite the historic Brexit vote. 
The anniversary of the signing of the historic treaty takes place on March 25 as the EU plans a series of celebratory events to mark the occasion. 
The official logo for the 60th anniversary of the Treaties of Rome, as well as the hashtag for initiatives #Roma2017 were presented on 31st May last year. Brexit aftershocks: Who's next to leave the EU? Wed, September 14, 2016 Britain has voted to leave the EU. So who's next? We look at which European countries want to hold their own EU referendum.
